v.v: After two days he will revive us;
Ephraim, what will I do with you?
So I have cut them to pieces by the prophets,
For I desire faithfulness and not sacrifice,
Like Adam they have broken the covenant;
Gilead is a city of evildoers
As gangs of robbers wait for someone,
In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing;
For you also, Judah, a harvest has been appointed,

v: For he has torn us to pieces, but he will heal us;
he has injured us, but he will bandage our wounds.
he will raise us up on the third day,
and we will live before him.
let us press on to know Yahweh.
His coming out is as sure as the dawn;
he will come to us like the showers,
like the spring rains that water the land.”
Judah, what will I do with you?
Your faithfulness is like a morning cloud,
like the dew that goes away early.
I have killed them with the words of my mouth.
Your decrees are like the light that shines out.
and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
they were unfaithful to me.
with footprints of blood.
so the priests band together to commit murder on the way to Shechem;
they have committed shameful crimes.
Ephraim’s prostitution is there, and Israel has become unclean.
when I will restore the fortunes of my people.
